Description: Accomodation

A business that provides lodging or temporary living quarters. This is a base-level category that should be used for all places that do not fit other categories defined for Hotel-Motel (500-5000-xxxx).

An establishment that provides short-term or extended stay lodging. Places in this category may also provide other services and amenities, such as meals, entertainment, dry cleaning and various other personal services.
An establishment that provides lodging to the public. These places usually have rooms that are accessible from a parking area.

A business that provides lodging to the public generally without room service. This is a base-level category that should be used for all places that do not fit other categories defined for Lodging (500-5100-xxxx).

An establishment that provides an inexpensive lodging place for travelers. Lodging arrangements are usually in dormitory settings where a guest can rent a bed or bunk bed. Guests often share amenities with other guests.
An establishment that provides a designated area for short-term camping. These places generally serve tent, trailer or recreation vehicle (RV) camping.
An establishment that provides lodging in an adjacent building next to the main structure. Guest houses are generally a small house or cottage.
An establishment that provides lodging and breakfast at an inclusive price. Bed and Breakfasts are typically private homes that contain a limited number of bedrooms.
An establishment that provides rental cottages or rooms. Resorts generally provide various recreational facilities, such as bowling, restaurants, swimming or mini golf.
An establishment that provides lodging designed for romantic encounters, or short rests, but usually not requiring an overnight stay.
An establishment that provides lodging with a traditional Japanese-style setting. Ryokans commonly contain matted flooring, sliding doors, shared rooms/baths, and serve traditional Japanese food.

Public land preserved and maintained for recreational use. This is a base-level category that should be used for all places that do not fit other categories defined for Park-Recreation (550-5510-xxxx).
A protected area preserved and maintained for public enjoyment including fairgrounds.
A sporting activity area that is accessible to the public.
A designated area containing plants, flowers, trees or other vegetation. This includes private and public gardens. Common examples include conservatories and botanical gardens.
A coastal area preserved and maintained for public enjoyment that is adjacent to lakes, oceans, rivers and connecting bay/harbors.
A designated area that is open to the public for the purposes of social, educational, or cultural activities, in addition to amateur individual and team sports.
A designated area at a ski resort that provides access to the top of the mountain.
A designated area providing access to scenic viewpoints. Scenic points generally are located along scenic roadways and have regional significance.
A designated point where an off-road vehicle trail begins. The off-road trailhead may contain restrooms, maps, signposts and informational centers.
A designated point where a trail begins. The trailhead may contain restrooms, maps, signposts and informational centers.
A designated area or trail for driving off-road vehicles (4WD, ATVs, etc).
A designated area where people can camp using tents or camper vans for overnight stays in the outdoors.
An establishment or designated area that provides amenities specific to outdoor activities.
A Ranger Station is a building within a park or other outdoor recreation area which is usually public and affiliated with the park where it is located.
An outdoor location that offers bicycle repairs and maintenance as a self-service.

An establishment that provides rides or other entertainment. This is a base-level category that should be used for all places that do not fit other categories defined forAmusement or Holiday Park (550-5520-xxxx).
An establishment that provides a park containing rides or other entertainment. Certain amusement parks may be theme-based. For example, Disney World, Sea World or Six Flags.
An establishment where animals are exhibited in cages or large enclosures for the public.
An establishment where wild animals are exhibited in an open environment for the public.
An establishment where animals are exhibited in their natural environment for the public.
An establishment where fish and other aquatic life are exhibited.

An establishment that offers downhill skiing, snowboarding and other winter sports. Ski resorts generally include multiple ski lifts, lodging facilities and other related amenities. Ski resorts are often nationally or regionally recognized.
An establishment where various species of animals are exhibited for the public. Examples of animal parks include zoos, aquariums, wild animal parks or wildlife refuges.
An establishment that provides access to recreational water areas. Water parks generally include water slides, splash pads, spray grounds (water playgrounds), lazy rivers or other related amenities.
